116966.name: Death by Degrees
116966.description:
Death by Degrees was initially a spin-off from the Tekken series of fighting games. Originally announced with the title "Nina", its eventual title was chosen as a reference to its multiple-degree fighting system.

Nina Williams, world-renowned assassin, has been hired by the CIA and MI6 to join a team which is attempting to infiltrate "Kometa," a notorious criminal organization. The team's strategy involves gaining access to the target through a fighting tournament being held on the "Amphitrite," a luxury cruise ship owned and operated by Kometa. A leaked video on the Internet showed a Kometa ship exploding within the Bermuda Triangle, and it is feared that they are working on some kind of superweapon in the aftermath of the fall of the Soviet Union. Nina's official cover involves infiltration as a competitor in the tournament. However, Nina is also the team's "sweeper"; should her partners fail, she must finish the job. Nina enters the competition, but is quickly discovered and captured. She soon receives a communication informing her of the team's failure and the death of one of the agents named John Doe (killed by Kometa executive Edgar Grant), and that she must now conduct the operation herself. Nina must fight her way through Kometa's forces and expose the truth behind its criminal activities. As she progresses in her mission, Nina fights the Kometa's top executives, starting with the personal bodyguard and lover of Lana Lei, Bryce. She then moves on to photograph a meeting of the directors, with the help of MI6 agent Alan Smithee.

Nina barely escapes the cruise ship with her life, and is taken to a Kometa Island research facility. Here, she encounters Lukas Hayes, a scientist who informs her about Kometa's plan to use satellites to heat and activate methane hydrate on the ocean floor. The result is bubbling which causes ships to lose their buoyancy. The weapon thus has the power to destroy naval vehicles from afar, sinking them to the bottom of the sea. Hayes' plan was to find a new energy source and alternative to fossil fuels, but his research was twisted into a form of warfare. The project is Salacia, the mysterious operation CIA and MI6 have heard rumors of. Nina realizes that she must stop the project, and takes on the second Kometa executive, Enrique Ortega. However, he is joined by Anna Williams (Nina's sister), hired along with the Tekken Force as bodyguards. After briefly engaging in combat with Anna, Nina continues on her mission and manages to kill Enrique. Lukas Hayes, however, is also killed as Lana Lei arrives and recovers a case which houses the electronics to operate Salacia's satellites. With Alan's help, Nina escapes the compound by helicopter, chasing Lana Lei back to the luxury cruise ship.

For a second time, Nina must fight her way through the Kometa boat, only this time against advanced cyborg soldiers, another of Lei's weapons projects. After recovering the keys to her quarters, Nina finds Salacia and engages with Lana. After her defeat, they are interrupted by Alan, who is revealed as Kometa executive Edgar Grant. Shooting Lana, he acknowledges that he is also a sweeper, there to destroy all evidence of his part in the atrocities. Before he can kill Nina, however, Lana shoots him dead, and escapes to a secret room. There, Nina witnesses her powering Salacia, targeting methane hydrate pockets all around the United States coastline. Nina finishes Lana off before she can continue with her insane plan, and makes her way to an escape pod as a self-destruct mode is activated on the boat. Her pod, however, explodes, and Nina lands on the ship's edge. As a rescue helicopter comes for her, she is knocked down by none other than Anna Williams. The two sisters face off as the ship nears destruction, and almost both fall to their deaths. However, the two grudgingly work together to escape and grab the helicopter rope line, with Nina having a flashback to the events prior to her father's death, in particular the moments following when the two sisters comforted one another. Anna drops Nina into the ocean after saying that they are now even. Nina watches on as rescue boats approach from behind her, the Kometa ship exploding and sinking, as Anna leaves on the helicopter.

The game is fully controlled by the analog sticks. The left analog stick is touch-sensitive; through various degrees of holding, tapping or pressing along with other buttons allows Nina to walk, run or evade. The right analog stick is used for offensive moves.

The game's most remarkable feature is the ability to allow Nina to use her martial arts skills to break the bones of her enemies through use of carefully aimed attacks. These attacks do more damage to the enemy and show the player the damage being inflicted on the opponent's skeletal structure. Strangely, this does little to actually disable opponents, as they often continue to use limbs that have been literally shattered, as well as survive blows to the head that would cause the skull to practically explode, without even losing consciousness.

Once the game is completed, "Anna Mode" will be unlocked, offering the player the ability to play as Nina's younger sibling, Anna. Various outfits can be unlocked throughout the game, which include a bikini, cocktail dress, purple jumpsuit, black and silver stealth suit. Playing the game a second time causes LCD crates throughout the game to contain infinite supplies of certain weapons, such as infinite katana and infinite rail-gun. After completing the game twice, the wrestling costume as seen in the opening FMV is also unlocked. A third clear game file additionally unlocks "Tekken 2 Nina", which instead of an outfit is actually a different facial and bodily construction, exactly as she appears in the Tekken title, in low resolution.

Source: Wikipedia, "Death by Degrees", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116967.name: Smithsonian Artifact or Fiction
116967.description:
From Publisher:

Is that Smithsonian fact unbelievably true or outrageously false? Sometimes it’s hard to tell the difference! Each player takes turns writing down the correct answer to a question, along with one they made up. Everyone guesses which answer they believe is a fact and which one is fiction. The player who gets most tokens by guessing correctly or bluffing the best wins!

- It’s a trivia game with a twist. You don’t have to have the correct answer just the most believable one!
- Fascinating facts and pictures accompany each question
Rewards creative thinking and creative writing

Includes:
290 Cards
60 Tokens
1 Answer Pad
6 Pencils
1 Set of Rules

116968.name: Destruction Derby: Arenas
116968.description:
Destruction Derby Arenas is the sixth and final installment of the Destruction Derby series. Based around the real-life sport of demolition derby driving, the game involves wrecking other cars for points, or driving cars as a simple stock car race.

This particular game is notable for being one of the first PS2 games that had an online play feature. While it was the first title of the Destruction Derby series released for the PS2, the game was met with, overall, fairly low reception in comparison to its predecessors, due to its deviation of realism and reliance on a more cartoonish tone. It was therefore the last game of the Destruction Derby series, but the car crashing genre still continued with the likes of Flatout, which arguably could be the spiritual successor of Destruction Derby.

Source: Wikipedia, "Destruction Derby Arenas", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Its website is currently inoperative: http://www.ddarenas.com/

116969.name: Gallop!
116969.description:
From the Publisher:

Which animal will win the race? Open the magical Scanimation door to see who will move on each round. You’ll be strutting, galloping, and fluttering along as you race around the track. Guess correctly to win! Based on the popular book by Rufus Butler Seder.

- A first game for preschoolers just learning to play games
- Players can hop, fly or run, just like the animals do!
- Each player takes a turn opening the Scanimation door to see which animal goes next.

Includes:
1 Game Board with Magical Scanimation Door
2 Dice
5 Animal Movers
4 Guess Tokens
1 Set of Rules

116970.description:
What comes first, the chicken or the egg?? In this game the answer is clear: The chicken!

Roll the dice, if you roll grey or brown you may take a chicken of that colour - or let all of your chickens of that colour lay an egg.

If someone rolls pink, then you have to be fast - the first player to grab the worm may let all of his/her chickens lay an egg.

If you roll blue you may take the rooster - now if you still have the rooster the next time you chickens lay eggs - then they each lay two eggs...

The winner is the the player with the most eggs.

See how to play here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vxQ8vSZjB_M
116970.name: Kokoriko

116971.name: Digimon Rumble Arena 2
116971.description:
Digimon Rumble Arena 2, known as Digimon Battle Chronicle in Japan, is the sequel to Digimon Rumble Arena and has a similar style of gameplay as Super Smash Bros. Melee, except with a health meter. Digimon Rumble Arena 2 is based on the Digivolve techniques of Digimon battling it out in a battle royal and to see who is the strongest Digimon.

The game features characters from the first four seasons of the anime: Digimon Adventure, Digimon Adventure 02, Digimon Tamers, and Digimon Frontier. Each one has their own special moves and "digivolutions", as well as slightly varying normal attacks and taunts.

Playable Characters:
Agumon: It has a mix of weak and strong attacks, but good variety in his Pepper Breath attack. He digivolves to Greymon and WarGreymon.
Gomamon: Weak offense fast. Gomamon digivolves to Ikkakumon and Zudomon.
Biyomon: Has an advantage with speed, but low on offense and defense. Biyomon digivolves to Birdramon and Garudamon.
Flamemon: He has high defense good offense and good speed. He can digivolve to Agunimon and BurningGreymon.
Gabumon: A slow, but very offensive oriented Digimon. His digivolutions are Garurumon and MetalGarurumon.
Guilmon: Somewhat weak physically, but is very quick on his feet. His special attack, Pyrosphere moves forward and has a bit of a setback. His digivolutions are Growlmon and Gallantmon.
Gatomon: She is the 2nd fastest character in the game and also can paralyze their enemies. Her Digivolution line consists of Nefertimon and Angewomon. She is the only character who starts as a Champion level.
Patamon: Low statistics, but it's the fastest character in the entire game. Patamon digivolves to Angemon and MagnaAngemon
Palmon: She is fast and attacks with poison and the dust of sleep. Togemon and Lillymon are the digivolutions.
Tentomon: Fast and strong in both offense and defense, Tentomon can digivolve to Kabuterimon and Mega Kabuterimon.
Veemon: Limited range on all attacks, but powerful. His Vee-Headbutt, Vee-Knock-Out, and Vee-Punch moves can be very harmful. Flamedramon and Imperialdramon Fighter Mode are the digivolutions.

These are characters that are not available at first, but have to be unlocked by fulfilling certain conditions. All "Black" Digimon have the ability to absorb energy while grabbing the opponent.
BlackAgumon: A virus version of Agumon, with a slower, more powerful normal attack. He can digivolve to BlackGreymon and BlackWarGreymon. BlackAgumon is unlocked by beating the game with two different characters, or beating BlackAgumon during a "Surprise Attack".
BlackGabumon: A fire version of Gabumon. He can digivolve to BlackGarurumon and BlackMetalGarurumon. BlackGabumon is unlocked by beating the game with two different characters, or beating BlackGabumon during a "Surprise Attack".
BlackGuilmon: A black version of Guilmon. He can digivolve to BlackGrowlmon and ChaosGallantmon. BlackGuilmon is unlocked by beating the game with two different characters, or beating BlackGuilmon during a "Surprise Attack".
Duskmon: Well balanced, with one attack with infinite range, and another with teleportation. Duskmon is unlocked after his defeat in 1-player mode.
MaloMyotismon: Has a strong defense and melee attack. MaloMyotismon is unlocked after his defeat. His Ultra move, Pandemonium, scrambles the controls for other characters.
Diaboromon: Has a spin attack, and can fire a projectile as large as itself. His Ultra move, System Failure, de-digivolves other Digimon, and if the Digimon are already in their Rookie stages or cannot digivolve, it will do damage to them if the Digimon are near Diaboromon when he uses System Failure.
Omnimon: Well balanced, and able to perform quick combo attacks.
Neemon: Is fast, but has weak attacks, with often comical effects.

These characters are not playable but play a big part during different modes of the game.
Calumon: Calumon returns from the original Rumble Arena game, now the main character in the game's Crazy Chase mini-game. In the mini-game the players must give chase to Calumon and touch him 20 or above times to win. Calumon also makes cameos during the loading sequence of battles holding info boxes of random character information.
Phantomon: Phantomon is the only minor Digimon to make an appearance. He is a rare powerup known as Summon Phantomon. He randomly appears and stalks a Digimon. If a Digimon touches Phantomon, he'll instantly KO it with his Shadow Scythe. It is seemingly impossible to kill him, but he disappears after a set amount of time has passed.
D-Reaper: Although the character never appears, the stage Chaos Wastelands is fought inside the D-Reaper. The Jeri clone can be seen flying in the background.

Source: Wikipedia, "Digimon Rumble Arena 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116972.name: Mini-Taurus
116972.description:
From the back of the box:

Enter the mini-labyrinth version of Minotaurus to claim the mystical sword of Aegeus, but think ahead and plan your way wisely. Move the Minotaur to attack the other heroes, or move the walls to block them! Mini-Taurus is a quick and clever race game for 2-4 players.

Contents:

1 buildable LEGO Dice
4 LEGO microfigures
160 LEGO pieces
Rules booklet
Building instructions

116974.name: Auf der Reichsautobahn
116974.description:
Der Weg zum Ziel ein deutsches Spiel (subtitle)
Objective: be the first finishing the chosen travel route
- moving by turn -
1 each player chooses a travel route (blue, brown, green, red)
(each route touches 28 cities and 10 'bad luck' places)
1a with more than 4 players routes should be used backwards, too
2 roll the 2 dice (three times) - if the total result shows a number you need to enter a city/place ==> move forward; if not, don't move
3 ending on a place with 'bad luck' follow instructions printed cover inside

remarks:
game was published ~ 1936/8
a few years later ~ 1940 an updated version has been published ==> 'Auf der Reichsautobahn durch Großdeutschland' (Neu-Ausgabe)

116975.name: Diam's
116975.description:
Diam's is a game of combinations inspirated by traditional games : escoba and scopa. The objective is to recover diamonds on the market in order to form collections in its strongbox.

In turn, a player chooses between 2 ways of pick. Then he has to buy diamonds at the market (2 ways of buying) OR to secure diamonds in his strongbox (at least 3 same valors diamonds) OR to put one diamond card onto the market. At the end of his turn, he only keeps 5 cards in hand, the others are put onto the market. Each combination of diamonds in the strongbox scores point. For example : 3 diamonds "7" scores 10 points, 5 diamonds "7" scores 18 points. The player who scores most, win the set, a game is in 3 sets.

116976.name: Dino Stalker
116976.description:
Dino Stalker, known as Gun Survivor 3: Dino Crisis (Japanese: ガンサバイバー3 ディノクライシス Hepburn: Gan Sabaibā Surī Dino Kuraishisu?) in Japan, is an offshoot of the Resident Evil light gun shooter games, but based on the story of the Dino Crisis series. Though it can be played by other means, a light gun is recommended, as the game is one in a number of Capcom games that try to bridge the gap between light gun games and traditional games that allow the player greater range of control over their movements in the game.

Dino Stalker is the third installment in Capcom's Gun Survivor series. Although the Gun Survivor games are an offshoot of the Resident Evil series, Dino Stalker is the only game in the series without any ties to Resident Evil. It was followed by Resident Evil: Dead Aim.

The game focuses on the central character Lieutenant Mike Wired, who is caught in an intense dogfight during World War II. With nowhere to go, Mike appears to be doomed until he is suddenly teleported into the sky in the 3,000,000's, and must defend himself against an army of flying prehistoric predators.

When he makes it to the mainland, he sees more dinosaurs and must battle them single handedly with whatever weapons he can acquire. He hears a voice on his new wrist communicator, telling him to find a girl called Paula. When he does find Paula, she simply replies with "Trinity" before more dinosaurs appear. Trinity is actually a dinosaur, (a Troodon, to be precise), with significant intelligence and it can send other dinosaurs to attack the player, as it does during a boss fight.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dino Stalker", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116978.description:
The chase is on in the streets of LEGO City! Can the thieves get the money without setting off the alarm, or will the police catch up with them and put them all in jail? Everyone must think ahead if they want to win!

Players are divided into two teams: police and thieves. The thieves win if they steal all ten stacks of money. This is done by landing on a space next to a building and rolling the die to determine whether they get two stacks of money, set off the alarm allowing the police to deploy the helicopter to protect a building of their choice, or set off the alarm but still get away with one stack of money. The police win if they arrest all four thieves before they manage to get ten stacks of money. Capturing thieves involves landing on the same space as a thief.
116978.name: CITY Alarm

116979.name: Auf der Reichsautobahn durch Großdeutschland (Neu-Ausgabe)
116979.description:
Der Weg zum Ziel ein deutsches Spiel (subtitle)
Objective: be the first finishing the chosen travel route
- moving by turn -
1 each player chooses a travel route (blue, brown, green, red)
(each route touches 28 cities and 10 'bad luck' places)
1a with more than 4 players routes should be used backwards, too
2 roll the 2 dice (three times) - if the total result shows a number you need to enter a city/place ==> move forward; if not, don't move
3 ending on a place with 'bad luck' follow instructions printed cover inside

remarks:
game was published ~ 1940
a few years before ~ 1936/8 a predecessor version had been published ==> http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/116974/auf-der-reichsauto...
differences: borders are changed, Austria included, meeples are replaced by pewter cars ==> Fröha, Hilpoltstein (German producer of high quality meeples)

116980.name: Raw Danger!
116980.description:
Raw Danger!, known in Japan as Zettai Zetsumei Toshi 2: Itetsuita Kiokutachi (絶体絶命都市2 -凍てついた記憶たち- lit. The Desperated City 2: Frozen Memories?) is a survival game that follows six characters as they try to escape a city that is being flooded by torrential rains. The game is a sequel to Disaster Report. A further sequel, Zettai Zetsumei Toshi 3, was released for the PSP on April 23, 2009.

The year is 2010. The underground city, Geo City, is a project put together to design the safest and most advanced city ever built in the world. The newly-opened city is working great and the Mayor's Conference to commemorate the opening is going well, aside from a bit of rain outside. Joshua and Stephanie are just two of the waiters helping make the conference go as smoothly as possible. But, when the nearby Levee breaks and the Hudson River begins to flood the city from above, the building the conference is being held in begins to be pummeled and destroyed by the raging rapids. The city and everyone in it are in total panic and turmoil.

Players must think on their feet and utilize creative survival skills to have any hope of seeing their family again. Body temperature and health decrease when players are wet or in cold weather too long. They must find places to warm themselves and gather food, and find dry clothes or make them. In the end, players must run, climb, jump, and crawl their way out of this devastated city, while constantly trying to piece together information from emergency broadcasts and other victims of the disaster. The choices that the players make within the game affects the main storyline and dialog, and ultimately the ending of the game.

This game is able to interface with the Konami Para Para Paradise controller. This allows the player to design their own hand movements to be used when summoning rescuers. Players may also use the controller to simulate the "fireman carry", used to move unconscious characters.

Characters

Joshua Harwell is a college student working as a waiter at the Geo City Inaugural Ceremony Banquet when disaster struck. After the flooding starts Joshua is trapped in the banquet hall basement with another worker named Stephanie McMurrough. Joshua takes her along with him to escape the ill fated city.

Stephanie McMurrough is a college student working part-time as a waitress at the "Geo City Inaugural Ceremony Banquet". When the flooding starts, Stephanie gets trapped in the banquet hall basement, only to be rescued by Joshua. She tags along with him, going through many hardships along the way. Stephanie likes to be self-sufficient, even though her family is very wealthy. Her father even sends a major search party out to find a trace of his beloved daughter.

Amber Brazil is a university student as well as a suspect for murder. She arrived at her brother's crime scene right before the murderer fled. Because she was in the wrong place at the wrong time, she is the major murder suspect and is being held prisoner in the Geo City Police Station. She broke out, however, when the Geo City Police Station collapsed.

Aidan Chase is Goldstein's assistant. After the city began to flood, Aidan met Amber Brazil and saved her from the ongoing chases from the police. He later joins her to escape the city, survive, and to figure out the truth behind David Brazil's (Amber's brother), murder. It is later revealed that he was the one who murdered David. The player can cause his death or let him live so he can go to prison.

Isaac Schiller is a thirty-six year old taxi driver who hears about the "Geo City Inaugural Ceremony Banquet" from some customers inside a convenience store. He later meets Sophia Briggs in Downtown Geo when she asks for a ride in his car. He and Sophia must escape the city and uncover the mystery behind NorCal's ambitions...

Sophia Briggs is a reporter for Capital Weekly magazine. She was writing a cover story on the Geo City Inaugural Banquet before disaster struck and the whole city went topsy turvy. Before the flooding she bumped into Joshua while he was working and asked him to get her a waitress uniform so she could go undercover and get behind the scenes with the staff. After that she hitches a ride with Isaac and the two of them try and discover what NorCal is really up to. She seems to know Jaden Bradford, a NorCal employee, and Keith Helm, a survivor of the Capital City disaster.

Paige Meyer is a sixteen year old student at Del Ray High School. Her classmate, Emily Rose, constantly bullied her during school hours. Emily even locked Paige in a locker right before everyone began to evacuate to the school's gymnasium. Paige must go through a lot, between climbing over ledges and fighting off a deranged teacher.

Kelly Austin is a young student teacher at Del Ray High School. She used to live in Capital City where she witnessed her home and everything she loved get destroyed by the ongoing earthquakes. She came to Del Ray, obviously, to start anew. When the flooding starts she gets trapped under a piano from the school's music room, Paige saves her and the two of them make their way to the evacuation point you will see her again in the third Disaster Report.

Ivan Kozlov is a researcher for NorCal Pharmeceutical Geo City. He finds himself waking up shortly after the minor floodings not knowing where or who he is. Sitting at his side is a young woman who he does not know.

Sierra Young meets Ivan when he wakes up. Sierra is David Brazil's girlfriend and apparently knows Ivan through David. Ivan does not remember her because of his amnesia. Sierra asks Ivan to come with her to help her solve the murder of her boyfriend. Ivan agrees and tags along with her.

Keith Helm is one of the survivors of the earthquake 5 years ago in Capital City (in Disaster Report). This time, he is trying to figure out NorCal's ambitions along with Sophia Briggs. He can be seen around the city searching for information about NorCal. Along his investigation he bumps into Amber and Aidan, as well as Isaac.

Source: Wikipedia, "Disaster Report 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

From the North American/ European publishers, Agetec:

All order has collapsed and there is no choice but to escape.

Players must think on their feet and utilize creative survival skills to have any hope of seeing their family again. Body temperature and health decrease when players are wet or in cold weather too long - they must find places to warm themselves and scrap together meals from whatever they can find. In the end, players must run, climb, jump, and crawl their way out of this devastated city, while constantly trying to piece together information from emergency broadcasts and other victims of the disaster.

- Escape a horrific flood by any means necessary - Run, climb, jump, and crawl out of the devastated city
- Six playable characters and branching storylines to play through - each decision and discussion impacts how the storyline plays out
- Health decrease when players are wet or in cold weather too long - they must find places to warm themselves and scrap together meals
- Flooded urban environment is a sight unseen in videogames - it is frightening yet visually powerful

Source: The Publisher Website.

116981.description:
Publisher blurb:

Defend Hoth™ as you battle against your friends and the Empire!

LEGO® Games is the world's first collection of games that you build, play and change. With the unique buildable LEGO Dice and changeable rules, LEGO Games is a great way of having fun together with family and friends.

It is a dark time for the Rebellion. Darth Vader has discovered Luke Skywalker’s secret base on the remote ice planet of Hoth™, and Imperial ground forces are ready to attack! The Battle for Hoth™ has begun in an exciting game of strategy and luck for 2 or 4 players. Game play approximately 10-20 minutes.

1 buildable LEGO® Dice
32 LEGO microfigures
Rules booklet
Building instructions




Game overview:

Star Wars: Battle of Hoth is a game for two or four players on a Lego game board. One player or team represents the empire, and the other player or team represents the Rebels. The players move their pieces over the assembled board and attack the opponent's pieces. Each piece has a range of fire and movement that dictates what damage can be done and at what distance. The board is a gridwork of interlocking Lego pieces that can be altered to change the layout, thus opening some movement paths that were previously blocked, and blocking movement elsewhere. The goal of the game is to eliminate the opposition's forces or leader.
116981.name: Star Wars: Battle of Hoth

116983.name: Phineas and Ferb
116983.description:
UNRELEASED GAME



Note that all details for this game are preliminary. If you have information about this game, you are invited to edit this section or submit corrections.




Phineas and Ferb the LEGO game? Yes, that's what it is. Details on how to play still to come...

116984.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 5 No 4 - April 2052)
116984.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, 50 YEARS AGO TODAY, STEVE JACKSON GAMES NEWS, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW, & WADA CHAPTER NEWS.

116985.name: Step Game
116985.description: Step Game is for very young players. The goal is to bring the first of his play the other side of the course. One piece consists of two balls attached by a cord. Player roll the color dice and advance his game piece one or the other side to a plot of the color indicated.

116986.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 5 No 5 - May 2052)
116986.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, SJ GAMES CAR WARS NEWS, WEB WATCH, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW, & WADA NEWS.

116987.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 5 No 6 - June 2052)
116987.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR & WADA NEWS.

116988.name: Anarchy (1987)
116988.description:
User Summary

Anarchy is a game by Micheal Sentinella, with music by Nigel Grieve, published by Hewson in 1987. You control a sort of tank in a maze. The aim is to destroy all cubes before the time is out, then go to the exit and the next area. There is 15 areas in the game. In the beginning of a game can you choose the acceleration of your tank between Low (novice), Medium (intermediate), and High (expert).

116989.name: Labyrinthiathan
116989.description:
From 1KM1KT description:
It’s a game of grand horror set during the American Civil War. I like to think it’s Lovecraftian in a way. The dice mechanic is simple and character creation uses special tarot-like cards. Inspired by "The House of Leaves," are you prepared to face the darkness?

116990.name: Ancipital
videogamehonor: 1984 Golden Joystick Best Original Game of the Year Nominee
116990.description:
User Summary

Ancipital is a shoot 'em up game from Llamasoft in 1984. You play as a man with a goathead going between different room. There is 100 rooms in the game, and you have to figure out how to kill the enemies and how to be able to exit to other rooms.

116992.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 5 No 7 - August 2052)
116992.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, STEVE JACKSON GAMES NEWS, WEB WATCH: NEW SITES, WADA NEWS, WEB WATCH: WADA ACTIVE CHAPTERS, & WEB WATCH: UPDATED SITES.

116993.name: A Night at Tosche Station
rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
116993.description:
From Introduction:

A Star Wars adventure game scenario set in the Rebellion era!
For use with the Secrets of Tatooine campaign pack

A long time ago, in a galaxy far, far away, an alliance of freedom-loving peoples challenged the tyrannical rule of the evil Emperor in an attempt to restore justice to the galaxy. The Rebel Alliance frequently relied upon smugglers and scoundrels of every sort to deliver the arms and equipment they needed to fight the Empire. Even though they met their contacts in secret, far-flung locations, these meetings were some of the most harrowing moments for the Rebels. They could be betrayed by their contacts, or found out by spies—or simply stumble into an Imperial patrol.

116994.name: Envoyer (Issue 62 - Dec 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Das friedliche Dorf in den Hügeln
116994.description: This issue includes reviews of Mechwarrior, DSA, Earthdown, Engel and Space Gothic books. Also included an adventure "Tempelschatz" and one adventure "Nur eine dumme Verwechslung" (both normaly for Midgard but useable for other systems, too)

116995.name: Cat and Mouse
116995.description:
From Introduction:

A Star Wars Miniadventure Using Ultimate Adversaries

“Cat and Mouse” is a Star Wars Roleplaying Game miniadventure for any era of play, but it’s probably best suited to the Rise of the Empire era. It’s designed for four to six heroes of 3rd to 5th level. Because the adventure deals with shady deals, gambling, and the black market, at least one of the player characters should be a scoundrel, noble, or other character with ties to the seedier side of the galaxy.

116996.name: Damsel in Distress
rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
116996.description:
From Introduction:

It is a time of desperate struggle. The Rebel Alliance, working from their secret bases, fights against the stranglehold of the Galactic Empire. Rebel spies gather information about the Empire’s strengths and weaknesses, seeking a vulnerability the Alliance can exploit. A Rebel ship carrying information vital to the Rebellion is trapped, as the forces of the Empire close in for the kill. The crew’s only hope lies in an Alliance rescue party reaching them in time…

Damsel in Distress is an adventure for the Star Wars Roleplaying Game designed for four to six 1st-level heroes in the Rebellion era, although it works perfectly well for other eras with some slight modifications. The group is assigned to a rescue mission to help save a damaged Rebel Alliance ship, the Stellar Damsel, and recover the information the ship was carrying.

116997.name: Death, Dirt, and the Nerf Rancher’s Daughter
rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
116997.description:
From Introduction:

A mission to a nerf ranch on Engebo V to buy a fresh supply of nerf steaks—a delicacy prized by the wealthy — seems like a simple enough task. But soon after the heroes arrive on the forgotten Outer Rim planet, a shocking accident will turn their visit into a terrifying ordeal of survival.

Death, Dirt, and the Nerf Rancher’s Daughter is a free mini-adventure for the Star Wars Roleplaying Game designed for four 6th-level characters. The setting is not specific to any particular era of play and can be adjusted to fit any time period in the game. Gamemasters can incorporate it easily into their ongoing campaigns as a side trek, use the story to launch a game set on the Outer Rim, or run it as a stand-alone over the course of one or two sessions. Some things have been left open for the GM to create or modify.

This adventure uses aliens and creatures from the Alien Anthology accessory. It also introduces the skekfish, a deadly new predator that was created using special guidelines in the Anthology that make it easy for you to whip up your own challenging critters!

boardgamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
116998.description:
In Thunderstone: Heart of Doom, you had a chance to face Doom's very heart, the eighth Thunderstone, and defeat the ancient evil – but winning that battle had unexpected consequences. It banished Doom, but also freed him to visit other worlds, so you advanced to the next world with him.

Thunderstone Advance: Towers of Ruin, which is fully compatible with all previous Thunderstone offerings, is the next stop in your adventure. In Thunderstone Advance you build your party of heroes to defeat the dreaded Thunderstone Bearers in their dungeons or wilderness. The player who defeats the most valuable monsters will win the day, but beware – those monsters have all-new tricks up their sleeves, and victory will not come easy.

Thunderstone Advance: Towers of Ruin includes new rules, all new cards in new card frames, and a new village and dungeon board.

Integrates with


Thunderstone
Thunderstone: Starter Set
116998.name: Thunderstone Advance: Towers of Ruin
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 22: Thunderstone Advance, Crowd Funding Board Games and Roleplaying in RPG Combats
Episode 27 - Tis Better to Have Loved and Lost
House Rules 34: Talking Thunderstone with AEG’s Jeff Quick
Session Impressions: Thunderstone Advance: Towers of Ruin
The Gaming Gang Episode 35: Mob Ties, Black Friday, Thunderstone Advance, and 1812: The Invasion of Canada, and More!
The Gaming Gang Extra Episode 36: The Gaming Gang Extra Episode 36: Jeff Quick Talks AEG and Thunderstone Advance

116999.name: The Fall of Cloud City
rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
116999.description:
From Introduction:

A new Star Wars adventure game scenario for use with the Rebellion Era Sourcebook

In this adventure, the heroes experience the Imperial takeover of Cloud City from right in the middle of it all.To escape the clutches of the Empire, they must be brave and resourceful.

The Fall of Cloud City is designed to be used along with the Bespin section of the Rebellion Era Sourcebook. You don’t have to have that book to play, but the background in it will prove helpful in running this scenario.

As the scenario opens, the heroes are tourists visiting the frontierlike Outer Rim Territories.They have come to Cloud City, on the gas giant planet Bespin, to tour the mining facilities and perhaps to take in some of the local color. This adventure takes place toward the end of the movie The Empire Strikes Back, just after Imperial troops have come to Cloud City — but before anyone knows they’re there.

That should be enough to get started.
May the Force be with you.

117000.name: ABC DRS3: Das Radiokultspiel für unterwegs
117000.description:
Travel board game version of Swiss Radio Station DRS 3's call-in game show ABC DRS 3.

Gameplay involves a Candidate player being asked to provide a word beginning with a known letter in response to a definition. The more words the Candidate can correctly identify within 60 seconds, the higher their score.

Players take turns as Moderator, Listener and Candidate during the game.

The game's question and answer content is in Swiss German. The box details and instructions are in Standard German.

The game comes with

100 question cards
6 microphone cards
1 hourglass
1 20-sided die

116501.name: Nova
116501.description:
User Summary:
Nova is a text adventure with graphics, written with GAC. The sun is soon a nova, and earth and moon is taken over by cyborgs. As cheif engineer your aim is to overseeing the final evacuation of earth. The game contains of 70 locations, and 2 mazes.

116502.name: Ivanhoe
116502.description:
Objective: be the very last of the round keeping Ivanhoe in your hands
'A Parlor game based on the story of Sir Walter Scott'
- acting by turn -
total 31 cards (15 duplicates + Ivanhoe)
1 entire pack is dealt - if someone holds a pair it's laid aside
2 player who holds Ivanhoe informs the others
3 during a turn you must draw a card - if you 'pair' ==> the 2 cards must lay down
4 player who holds Ivanhoe has the advantage drawing 2 cards
(from one or another or the same person)
5 when a player obtains Ivanhoe card must be shown to others
and then put back in his/her hand
6 after all cards have been formed into pairs player holding Ivanhoe wins
remarks:
Cards are: Ivanhoe (1), Lokesley (Robin Hood), De Bracy, Wamba the Jester, Princess Rowena, Rebecca, Sir Brian de Bois Guilbert, Isaac of York, Prior Aymer, King Richard, Friar Tuck, Prince John, Hubert, Cedric the Saxon, Athelstane, Reginald Front de Boeuf

116503.name: Jelly Chronicles HD
116503.description:
"Once upon a time, in a galaxy not that far far away... oh, wait a second! In this game you will have to reveal the story on your own!

Jelly Chronicles is a magic adventure into the Jelly World for both young and old. Test your power of observation in classic "spot the difference" game and challenge your skills in jigssaw puzzles full of beautiful and unique pictures. Jelly Chronicles lets you dream with your eyes wide open while you make your way through the epic Jelly story! It is a fairy tale you can't do without! Reveal the true story behind Jelly Invaders, Jelly Defense and more... "

Source: The Developer Website.

116504.name: Rebirth of Fortune
116504.description:
"“Rebirth of Fortune” is a tactical role-playing game borrowing the combat mode made famous by such Strategy RPGs as “Tactics Ogre” and “Final Fantasy Tactics.”Up to eight of your units battle hoards of mercenaries in turn-based, strategic combat on various terrains.
Upgrade and customize your own units to compete in a chess-like strategy game of position and power.

Goal of Game
Your eight individual units share a mutual relationship and utilize various strategies and skills according to their disposition. A devisive strategy is required to beat each of 50+ stages and various enemy AIs. If you eradicate the enemy you will be rewarded, and using the rewards fund you can upgrade your units and prepare for greater combat."

Source: The Developer Website.

116505.name: Sorcerer of Fortune
116505.description:
"Fortune Chronicle Episode #2

Sorcerer of fortune" is mutually accepted from the previous game "Rebirth of fortune" and focused on the sorcerers' among the various classes.

In the Fortune World, there is a magic energy called, Ether. You can get orbs as you refine the Ether. The Orb can be used for the resource to the magic. There is a class, Sorcerers, who uses orbs to spell the magic.

There are 8 orbs in the fortune world. You can use stronger magic as you place Orbs well-strategically.

40 Sorcerers with each story for new adventures and more than 250 various items. Meteor Dragon is related all of them and is centered in this Fortune World. Start your adventure to defeat the Meteor Dragon."

Source: The Developer Website.

116506.name: Mega Mindy - Skyrace
116506.description:
User Summary

In Mega Mindy Skyrace you have to get Mega Mindy over the different platforms to the other side of the level as quickly as possible. The quicker, the more points you get.

116507.name: Mega Mindy Transform Trouble
116507.description:
User Summary

The Transformation machine from Grandpa Fonkel is broken. Now Mieke cannot transform into Mega Mindy and the thief will take the money. Help repairing the machine by putting te parts of the machine on their right place.

Mega Mindy is a superhero from a belgian kids television show.

116508.name: Het Huis Anubis: De Donkere Strijd
116508.description:
User Summary

Het Huis Anubis is a Belgian television series. In this game: 'The Dark Battle' you have to solve a lot of mysteries on 5 different places. Are you ready to get to the end of the game together with the characters?

116509.name: Het Huis Anubis: Het Geheim Van Osiris
116509.description:
User Summary

Het Huis Anubis is a television series on Belgian television series.

In 'The Secret of Osiris' you need to help the inhabitants of the house. It takes you to a deserted inn, a beautiful garden with old artifacts and even to Egypt. You make a wonderful journey through time. Try to solve the puzzles and find the treasures and discover the secret of Osiris.

116510.name: NCAA March Madness 2005
116510.description:
User Summary

NCAA March Madness 2005 allows the gamer to use NCAA rosters from the 2004-2005 season. New to the 2005 installment are classic college teams that one can unlock and pit against current teams, mascots, cheerleaders, chants, and fight songs. Revamped game modes allow for much more detailed scouting reports, locker room management, and videos with real college coaches who talk about how to run a college basketball team. NCAA March Madness 2005 was released for both the PlayStation 2 and the Xbox.

116511.name: NCAA March Madness 06
116511.description:
From the back of the box

Featuring a deeper playbook that covers both ends of the court, NCAA March Madness 06 delivers the ultimate strategic basketball experience. Players can dominate rivals with an authentic brand of defense and push the ball on offense with an enhanced Floor General Playcalling system that features more sets than before. With the all-new EA SPORTS Lockdown Stick, defense creates offense by allowing players to pressure the ball, force turnovers and harass opponents on the court.

116512.name: Het Studio 100 Speeleiland
116512.description:
User Summary

In Studio 100 Speeleiland (Studio 100 Play Island) is a collection of different games made around the popular characters of the Studio 100 group: K3, Mega Mindy, Maja the bee and Amika.

116513.name: NCAA March Madness 99
116513.description:
User Summary

NCAA March Madness 99 is the second game in EA Sports' long-running college basketball series. It features University of North Carolina player Antawn Jamison dunking on the cover. Like its predecessor, NCAA March Madness 99 is a PlayStation exclusive.

116514.name: Singstar Studio 100
116514.description:
User Summary

Singstar game with all the big hits from Studio 100 characters. Includes: K3, Piet Piraat, Samson en Gert, Kabouter Plop, ...

116515.name: NCAA March Madness 2000
116515.description:
User Summary

NCAA March Madness 2000 is the third installment in EA Sports' college basketball series. The 2000 edition featured a different engine and marks the first time in the history of the franchise that EA outsourced the development of the game to another company. The game's cover features guard Steve Francis from the University of Maryland.

116516.name: NCAA March Madness 2001
116516.description:
User Summary

NCAA March Madness 2001 was the fourth game in the series and the last to be featured on the original PlayStation. Like the 2000 installment, the 2001 game was developed by Black Ops. The game's cover features Kenyon Martin from the University of Cincinnati.

116517.name: Plop en de Pinguïn
116517.description:
User Summary

Go with Plop and his friends to the south pole for an exciting adventure. Help the Penguin Pinki that is being chased by criminals. Play 10 funny gnome games and return Pinki to the south pole.

116518.name: NCAA Final Four Basketball
116518.description:
User Summary

NCAA Final Four Basketball was released for the Genesis and Super Nintendo and marks one of the earliest efforts to make a college basketball game featuring many teams.

116519.name: K3 en het IJsprinsesje
116519.description:
User Summary

K3 en het Ijsprinsesje (K3 and the Ice Princess) is based on the movie with the same name. In this game you and K3 have to help out the Ice Princess.

116520.name: K3 en de Vrolijke noten
116520.description:
User Summary

K3 en de Vrolijke noten or K3 and the happy notes is a children's game by Studio 100 based on their group K3. In this game the player has to find 50 notes through 50 minigames.

116521.name: Bumba: Lekker Smullen
116521.description:
User Summary

Bumba: Lekker smullen is an educational childrens videogame. The game uses different games and the main characters from Bumba to teach children. Bumba is a belgian television show.

116522.name: House of fun - Big & Small
116522.description:
Join Big and Small and have fun exploring their house in the countryside as you play your way through 8 fun games and activities! Featuring classic children’s games, including Sliding Tiles, Spot the Difference, Snap, Jigsaw plus many more! Each game is designed to help children develop early learning skills while in the company of the two unlikely best friends, Big and Small.

Source: The Publisher Website.

videogame: Baldur's Gate II: Shadows of Amn
Baldur's Gate II: Throne of Bhaal
Baldur's Gate: Tales of the Sword Coast
Neverwinter Nights: Hordes of the Underdark
The Temple of Elemental Evil: A Classic Greyhawk Adventure
116523.name: Ultimate Dungeons & Dragons
videogamecompilation: Baldur's Gate II: Shadows of Amn
Baldur's Gate II: Throne of Bhaal
Baldur's Gate: Tales of the Sword Coast
Neverwinter Nights: Hordes of the Underdark
The Temple of Elemental Evil: A Classic Greyhawk Adventure
116523.description:
User Summary

Ultimate Dungeons & Dragons is a gamecollection that was brought out by Atari in 2006. It contains a lot of the big titles from the D&D videogames. It contains 13 games on 17 cd roms.

- Baldur's Gate
- Tales of the Sword Coast
- Baldur's Gate 2
- Throne of Bhaal
- Demon Stone
- Dragonshard
- Temple of Elemental Evil
- Neverwinter Nights
- Shadow of Undrentide
- Hordes of the Underdark
- Icewind Dale
- Heart of Winter
- Icewind Dale 2

116524.name: Top Secret
videogamecompilation: Double Gold: Top Secret / Mountains of Ket
116524.description:
User Summary:
Top Secret is a text adventure with graphics, written with GAC, and published by Incentive Software. The Government has made a new missile that can destroy the planet. Your task is to break into a base and find evidence.

116525.name: The Alien from Outer Space
videogamecompilation: Double Gold: The Alien from Outer Space / Dragon's Tooth
116525.description:
User Summary:
The Alien from Outer Space is a text adventure with graphics, made by Andrew Pickford with GAC, and published by Incentive Software.

From the back of the box:
"We cannot say whether we have killed all mutants or not. The Alien Life form may still lie hidden inside one of us, but we don´t know who, so we cannot trust on another. Help us to destroy it before it destroys us."

116526.name: Bloody Sunday
116526.description:
From Introduction:

Does the party need a ship? Gold? Favor with the governor? One Sunday, the party will be blessed, for all of these will be offered to the brave . . .

116527.name: Dead Man's Hand
116527.description:
From Introduction:

Davey Jones locker. The edge of the map. And, of course, Hell. All very nasty places. But are any of them real, or are tales just born of earthly places? Well, some pirates may learn about Hell . . .

116528.name: Six Fingered Jack
116528.description:
From Introduction:

Should the party be seeking so ‘easy’ money, in a quiet, seaside town, there is a local legend, a tale of a thief, his ghost, and his treasure . . .

116529.name: Tales of the Bloody Sails
116529.description:
From Introduction:

Pirates often pick up new crewmen from the ships they defeat, but what about a ship that was lost long ago, with all hands aboard? We shall see...

116530.name: The Eye of the Cobra
116530.description:
From Introduction:

Most pirates will grab a sparkling jewel without a second thought. Perhaps that’s why so many sailors on account fall prey to strange curses . . .

116531.name: The Temple of Death
116531.description:
From Introduction:

Pirates are not historians nor are they interested in knowing culture or legends, but they should know their treasure . . .

116532.name: Area 51
116532.description:
From publisher blurb:

How long have you wondered what is really going on at Area 51? Now the time has come to take your chances and enter into the most secret base in the world. This booklet is a collection of three separate Adventures involving the infamous installation. These may be played individually, or linked together to make for one great journey into the unknown . . .

116533.name: Close Encounters
116533.description:
From publisher blurb:

This secret document contains dozens of case files, some easily explainable, and some that are otherwise. Some may amuse you, some may terrify you. But if you dare to investigate these files, be prepared to have your concept of the world and the cosmos turned up-side-down. For all the open-ended Events and Encounters in these pages . . . are real.

116534.name: Haunted Heartland
116534.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fear is the oldest and most fundamental emotion of mankind . . . But, is the world truly understood? Can tales of the dead still challenge or even change our world and our lives? Three separate Adventures into the land of the supernatural will ask this question with such power as to demand either truth or horror.

116535.name: Sightings
116535.description:
From publisher blurb:

A shadow in the corner, nothing more. An odd blur on a photograph, strange. Footsteps echoing behind you . . . beware! Ghosts are everywhere. Some people can see them, some can even speak to them. But what tales have they to tell? Why do they linger in this world? These are questions only the most determined and clever characters can answer, if they ask the right questions. All the open-ended Events and Encounters found in these pages will test you and perhaps even terrify you.

116536.name: Triangles of Terror
116536.description:
From publisher blurb:

What lies beyond the sky? Where do those who vanishe in the triangular zones around the world really go? Where do the triangular ships come from? The voyage into the paranormal world is not a linear one, but like a triangle itself a 3-dimensional plotting through space, time, and wonder. Of course, this leaves the normal world behind along with everyone in it who will fail to see the truth of all these things . . . being real.

116537.name: Dragon's Tooth
videogamecompilation: Double Gold: The Alien from Outer Space / Dragon's Tooth
116537.description:
User Summary:
Dragons Tooth is a text adventure with graphics, by Phillip McHardy with GAC, published by Incentive Software. The people of the north has a sorcerer that have created a dragon that with his fire destroys the field for the people in the south. The only way to defeat the dragon is to find a dragons tooth and give it to a wizard that is kept in a dungeon maze.

116538.name: Windows Beyond
116538.description:
From publisher blurb:

This secret document contains profiles on three highly sensitive extra-terrestrial encounters. These open-ended adventures will provide pieces to the greatest puzzle in human history, but pieces only. What will you do with them? Of course, none of what you are going to find within these documents ever happens . . . officially.

116539.name: Phenomenon: Official Rules
116539.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dare you to read this book? The government may not want you to. Who knows what malevolent spirits this forbidden text might release? You may be led off the path of righteousness into the realm of the supernatural. But if you dare, you may now secure your copy of this secret book, which provides all the rules of reality and beyond. But be forewarned: this is a 'Majic' project, classified 38 levels above Top Secret, and it is still experimental, cutting-edge role-playing game material.

116540.name: The Ket Trilogy
videogameversion: BBC Micro / Acorn Electron Cassette edition
116540.description:
User Summary:
The Ket Trilogy is a compilation of the three games in series by the same name. It's three text adventures, all with graphics, and all published by Incentive Software. The games are written by R. A. McCormack.

The game are:

Mountains of Ket
Temple of Vran
The Final Mission

116541.name: Manuel of the Plains
116541.description:
From the cover page:

A submission for the rpggeek.com Holiday Adventure Contest 2011

This holiday adventure does not require any specific system. It is an adventure for one GM and one player – perhaps a holiday present to one’s spouse! I freely admit the title was originally a cursory misreading of an old TSR book, Manual of the Planes. However, it has nothing to do with that book.

In fact, this adventure is written with a certain well-known hero in mind. One whose adventures were first published in 1919 – hence in a work that is now public domain: The Curse of Capistrano. However, I am not allowed to use the hero’s name due to the insanely greed-ridden intellectual property laws of the USA: a parasitic corporation (which did not create the character nor his distinctive look) is willing to take people to court to prevent them from using his name and look without their permission. Don’t get me wrong: I own intellectual property myself and am all for legitimate, valid, justifiable, well-founded, sane readings of the law. However, the fact that I cannot specify the name of a character in this adventure, even though the author, Johnston McCulley, is long dead and the initial book itself is in the public domain, is obscene. But enough ranting in a Christmas adventure.

You will have no trouble recognizing the character I am here calling Manuel of the Plains. He lives in Los Angeles in 1820 and fights oppression, corrupt officials (and, if he had known of them, greedy IP laws), always favoring the poor and downtrodden. He dresses in black, wears a black mask, is a superb swordfighter, frequently carves his initial on his opponents and their official posters, and his nom de guerre is the Spanish word for “fox.” Yes, it’s Manuel of the Plains! You, of course, should substitute the real name every time you see “Manuel” in this adventure.

116542.name: Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Beginner Box Pathfinder Society Character Creation Guide
116542.description:
From the publisher's website:

Ready for the next step from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Beginner Box? The best way to find Pathfinder Roleplaying Game action in your area is to get involved with Pathfinder Society Organized Play, a huge international Pathfinder campaign with tens of thousands of players. This guide provides a step–by–step walkthrough of the Pathfinder Society character creation process while referring you back to the Hero’s Handbook. These instructions allow for a seamless transition from the Beginner Box to Pathfinder Society play.

116543.name: NCAA Final Four 99
116543.description:
User Summary

NCAA Final Four 99 is the first installment in 989 Sports' college basketball franchise. The game boasted about its offensive and defensive play options, its realistic graphics based on motion-capture technology based on the basketball moves of Paul Pierce, and 250 Division I schools that are playable. Commentary is provided by Quinn Buckner.

116544.name: NCAA Final Four 2000
116544.description:
User Summary

NCAA Final Four 2000 is the second installment in the 989 college basketball franchise. The 2000 edition has 300 teams and includes authentic chants and fight songs.

116545.name: NCAA Final Four 2001
116545.description:
User Summary

NCAA Final Four 2001 is the third installment in the college basketball franchise from 989 studios. The 2001 gmae is the last game of the franchise to appear on the original PlayStation and the first to appear on the PlayStation 2.

116546.name: NCAA Final Four 2002
116546.description:
User Summary

NCAA Final Four 2002 is the fourth installment of the American college basketball franchise from 989 Studios. The game marks the series' second season on PlayStation 2 and the first year that the game was not released on the original 32-bit PlayStation. The game received extremely mixed reviews, being scored extremely highly by some reviewers and getting very low scores from others.

116547.name: NCAA Final Four 2003
116547.description:
User Summary

NCAA Final Four 2003 is the fifth installment of 989 Studios' college basketball franchise. The 2003 edition introduced 30 new dunks and expanded the number of playable teams.

116548.name: NCAA Final Four 2002
116548.description:
User Summary

NCAA Final Four 2004 marks the sixth and final installment of 989 Studios' college basketball series. Along with its sister franchises, NBA Shootout and NFL GameDay, Final Four was cancelled after the 2004 installment due to an across the board failure to compete with other sports game companies such as Electronic Arts.

116549.name: The Game of Merry Christmas
116549.description: The Game of Merry Christmas is probably the earliest known version of Mall Madness type game. In the game, players roll the dice and move to make their way through the streets of the village. Players visit the local shops and spend their money to purchase all the items on their families Christmas wishlists. The first player to buy all their items and returns home will be the winner in this vintage Parker's Brothers game.

116550.name: NCAA Final Four 2004
116550.description:
User Summary

NCAA Final Four 2004 is the sixth and final installment in 989 Studios' college basketball franchise. Along with NBA Shootout and NFL GameDay, NCAA Final Four as a franchise came to an end after 2004 due to the lack of commercial success of 989 sports titles for the PlayStation 2.

116551.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 3 No 2 - February 2050)
116551.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, AUTODUEL EARTH, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, DUELING DISCOVERIES, 50 YEARS AGO TODAY, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, & WADA NEWS.

116552.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 3 No 3 - March 2050)
116552.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, BLASTS FROM THE PAST, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, DUELING DISCOVERIES, 50 YEARS AGO TODAY, THE FIRING RANGE, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, NANS TICKER, ROGUE MATTER, THE SHOWROOM, TALEPIPES, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW, & WADA NEWS.

116553.name: Duck Hunter
116553.description:
The whole family can experience real-life hunting – rules, safety, decoys, waterfowl identities, fun, excitement, laughs! Great fun for a hunter, birdwatcher, or anyone interested in waterfowl because it involves 2-4 players in hunting strategy, bird identification, and safety practices used by good sportsmen. The object is to be the first player back to the Clubhouse with the "bag limit" of birds (at least 4 bird pictures with matching description cards).

Starting at the clubhouse, roll the dice and move that number of colored spaces. You may move either way on the board, and you may choose to take an inside path to reach the color space that you want. At each space you collect a card of the matching color: Green for a bird picture, orange for a bird description, or yellow for a situation card which explains a safety tip or legal point. When drawing a situation card, follow the instructions; it may send you to the Dog Training School, Sporting Goods Store, or Skeet Shooting Field! (The tan square has no matching deck, so no card is drawn.) When you have collected four different bird cards and their matching descriptions, hurry back to the Club House to claim your win!

Duck Hunter is packaged in a handsome, full-color box which contains the game board, instructions, four tokens, two dice and three card decks. One deck contains beautifully executed, full-color pictures of birds, the second deck has full descriptions of birds and their habitats and the third deck contains situation cards which remind players of proper hunting procedures, present comedic pitfalls, and provide penalties and bonuses.

The bird pictures are by internationally renowned wildlife artist Bob Hines. He was the only National Wildlife Artist to be employed by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service.

116554.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 3 No 4 - April 2050)
116554.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, NANS TICKER, 50 YEARS AGO TODAY, HEAVY METAL, NANS TICKER, & WADA NEWS.

116555.name: Argentilandia
116555.description:
The idea is the players get to fight for Victory Points that provide provinces and Industries.

The board is a map of Argentina, and each province has assigned a number from 2 to 12. The player in his/her turn, throws two dice at first, and the resources are distributed according to locations in the province that has the number of dice. Then, s/he can pay resources for locations in the province or in an industry.

The player who achieves 16 VPs at the end of his/her turn, is the winner. This is essential to gain control of several provinces and industries and to maximize the powers of the Officer Corrupt, Unionists and the Stockbrokers.

116556.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 3 No 5 - May 2050)
116556.description:
User Summary

In this article: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, 50 YEARS AGO TODAY, NANS TICKER, VEHICLE WATCH, & WADA NEWS.

116557.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 3 No 6 - June 2050)
116557.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, BLASTS FROM THE PAST, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, 50 YEARS AGO TODAY, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, NANS TICKER, VADR, & WADA WIRE.

116558.name: Nightmare Creatures 2
116558.description:
Taking place in 1934 London and Paris, players control Wallace, a captive in Adam Crowley's genetics hospital. Wallace carries an axe and wears bandages and a dark trench coat. Wallace escapes the hospital and seeks out Crowley, battling his monsters along the way.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nightmare Creatures II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116559.name: Eat Them!
116559.description:
Inspired by the wave of monster films such as Godzilla that reached its peak in the 50s, and with an added dash of Hammer Horror, Eat Them! lets you control a series of towering monsters as they smash, crash and munch their way across a number of cityscapes and wraps it all up in a distinctive and colourful comic book art style.

Source: The Developer Website.

116560.name: Savage Moon
116560.description:
Savage Moon is a tower defence game in which the player must develop strategies for protecting an off-world mining facility from attack by Insectocytes; a carnivorous creature sent by the living planet or Imoon. The insectocytes are its response, its auto-immune system defending itself against attack from a mining corporation intent on drilling the life-force from the animate asteroids they find.

Source: The Developer Website.

116561.name: Grand-Stand Base Ball
116561.description:
Promotional game, published by Pluto Water, a leading laxative supplier around 1910 onwards.

The game is a simple spin and see the result. The spinner has a remarkable 24 'sections' it can point towards after it stops spinning. No skill needed, just record the game with paper and pencil.

116562.name: A World Aflame
116562.description: Osprey miniatures rules covering the Interwar period of the twentieth century: Russian Civil War, Very British Civil War and all points in-between. The rules are intended for games using 28mm miniatures.

116563.name: Wir rufen Deutschland
116563.description:
Objective: be the first getting rid of all your puzzle pieces (= federal states of reunified -after WW II- Germany with all territories around 1936)
- acting by turn -
1. a 'white' map of pre WW II Germany is laid down (4 pieces)
2. each player gets an equal amount of federal states (puzzles)
and their emblems
3. turn the spinner - showing the name of a federal state: if you possess correspondent puzzle place it on the map (should fit); hereafter or if you didn't possess it ==> next player
4. game ends if someone places his/her last puzzle piece
remarks:
produced mid 50's it's design is simulating a game published before WW II (may be to fool collectors spending too much money for it); the design of federal states in the east of Germany is like 'wishful thinking' but political incorrect
no product no., no date... maps produced by Atlantik-Verlag Paul List, Munich

116564.name: Winko Baseball
116564.description:
Tiddlywinks mechanic.

The board is a baseball field, with green felt at home plate. You place your tiddlywink there and flick it on to the board. Where it lands determines the result of the action Possible results include;
Strike
Batter Out/Sacrifice
Base on Balls
Single
Out
Two Base Hit
Three Base Hit
Home Run

Basic baseball rules apply to any result. Take turns at bat and aim to make as many runs as possible.

116565.name: Quiz & Co. Junior, 5-6 Jahre
116565.description:
190 questions and answers for 5-6 years old children.

First assignment of colors, shapes, numbers and the first knowledge questions with colorful illustrations.

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

116566.name: Quiz & Co. Rätsel, Spaß, Rekorde
116566.description:
"Puzzles, Fun, Records"

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

116567.name: Quiz & Co. 1. Schuljahr
116567.description:
750 questions and answers for 1st grade - 6-7 years old children.

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

116568.description:
1000 questions and answers for 2nd grade - 7-8 years old children.

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

116569.name: Quiz & Co. 3. Schuljahr
116569.description:
1000 questions and answers for 3rd grade - 8-9 years old children.

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

116570.name: Quiz & Co. Pferde
116570.description:
Questions and answers about horses

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

116571.name: Quiz & Co. Rund um die Welt
116571.description:
500 questions and answers Around the World

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

116572.name: Quiz & Co. Sport
116572.description:
500 questions and answers about sport

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

116573.name: Quiz & Co. Tiere
116573.description:
Questions and answers about animals

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

116574.name: Quiz & Co. 4 Schuljahr
116574.description:
1250 questions and answers for the 4th grade - 10-11 years old children.

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

116576.name: Quiz 2008
116576.description:
110 quiz cards with a total of 1760 questions with three answer choices.
Who answers correctly may roll the dice and move accordingly on the game board who answers incorrectly stops. First player who reaches to the last week of the year wins the game.

116577.name: Virtual Worlds
116577.description:
User Summary: Virtual Worlds is a compilation with four game developed by Incentive Software and released by Domark in 1991.

The game are:

Driller
Total Eclipse
Castle Master
Castle Master II: The Crypt

116578.name: Sharpe's Deeds
videogamecompilation: Double Gold: Black Fountain / Sharpe's Deeds
116578.description:
User Summary:
Sharpe's Deeds is a text adventure with graphics, made by Linda Wright with GAC, and published by Incentive Software. You play as the person that stand to inherit the estate of Ferdinand Sharpe. Sharpe is now dead and to claim your inheritance you must visit the village of Sharpley, the former home of your uncle.

116579.name: Fate Of The Terra Ariel
116579.description:
Taken from the Introduction under About the Adventure.

Fate of the Terra Ariel is an adventure for Savage Worlds. It is designed for one GM and four players although it can be easily modified for more of less. Other than the Savage Worlds core rulebook, everything needed to play the adventure is contained in this document.

Four pre-generated characters are provided.

116580.name: Lustiges Einmaleins
116580.description:
Objective: be the first calculating fast & correct - placing all required slides on your board forming a completed puzzle
- acting by turn -
1 one player acts as question master
2 each player gets a small board with 2 x 4 empty spaces
3 question master draws a hidden slide (bag) with a math multiplication function (within times table)
4 player whose board shows correct answer must reply (if not within a certain time: penalty; wrong: even higher penalty)
5 slide is put properly on the board
6 next slide is drawn...
remark:
early published game ~ 1900

116581.name: X-COM: Complete Pack
116581.description:
User Summary

This is the third compilation release of the X-COM games, including the main five titles of: X-COM: UFO Defense (or UFO: Enemy Unknown), X-COM: Terror from the Deep, X-COM: Apocalypse, X-COM: Interceptor, and X-COM: Enforcer.

The last title had only been released in 2001 and had endured the collapse of its publisher, Hasbro Interactive. This release asserted the rights of the new owners, 2K Games.

116582.name: Uprising X
116582.description:
Back of the Box

Battle your way through over 20 levels of intense combat action, alone or with a friend, in a fight to the death. As commander of a futuristic war machine, you have a huge array of weaponry as well as an entire army of infantry, tanks, aerial assault vehicles, and bombers at your disposal. Unleash the most destructive force humanity has ever seen and determine the future of the galaxy.

116583.name: Mission Omega
116583.description:
Mission Omega is a computer game published in 1986.

The United States of Europe vessel Windwraith has been sent to intercept a mysterious object the size of a small moon which is speeding towards Earth. Robots must infiltrate the mystery-ship (dubbed the "Omega") and deactivate it within the hour or Earth will be destroyed.

Gameplay is a mixture of arcade adventure, maze game and strategy. The player controls robots (which are designed, built and named in-game) around the interior of the Omega and must shut down its four reactors. These robots have a limited amount of artificial intelligence and can be programmed to take set routes or allowed to explore of their own accord. The player can also directly control the robots. Occasionally, simple puzzles (often involving setting levers correctly) must be solved or hostile robots aboard the Omega must be combatted.

The player has one hour in real-time to deactivate Omega's four reactors.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mission Omega," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116584.name: The Red Crown Game
116584.description:
Promotional item by Red Crown, the oil and petrol supplier.

It is a simple spin and move game. If you land on a square with instructions, they must be obeyed. The track is described in the rules as the 'Road to Better Mileage'. This would have been a much better name for the game, but they went for the safe, mundane option.

The first one to reach the end of the 'road', wins.

116585.name: Adventure C: Ship of Doom
videogameversion: English/European ZX Spectrum (Artic Logo) Cassette edition
English/European ZX Spectrum Cassette (Incentive Software re-release) edition
English/European ZX Spectrum Cassette (Sinclair Research re-release) edition
English/European ZX81 Cassette (Sinclair Research re-release) edition
116585.description:
User Summary:
Ship of Doom is a text adventure, published by Artic Computing. Your spaceship has been drawn by a Graviton Beam onto an Alien Cruiser. Your aim is now to set your space ship free by pressing a the control button of the beam in the Cruisers main computer room.

116586.name: 4Towers Onslaught: Combo TD
116586.description:
"Start with just 4 simple towers and combine them in different ways to access many many more abilities and effects! Find the right tower combinations to fend off the alien swarms as they get bigger, faster and stealthier."

Source: The Developer Website.

116588.name: Absolute Instant
116588.description:
User Summary

In Absolute Instant, the world's first teleport shooter, you take control of a cutting edge technology called Absolute Instant, with this newfound power now you can fight the oppressive Celestians and free once and for all the Terrestrians.

116589.name: Alien Menace
116589.description:
User Summary

Alien Menace is the videogame adaptation of the card game Alien Menace. In this game you can only play as the humans and the AI control the aliens.

In a devastated space base living hell just broke out, you need to go from room to room looking for weapons, energy but beware of the alien abominations that plague the area.

116590.name: Wahr oder Gelogen: Kinder
116590.description:
Wahr oder Gelogen Junior version.

660 incredible stories that are true or a lie. Flying fish build their nests on the branches of coconut trees. Even the Romans 2000 years ago produced ice cream and eaten...etc
Two of 660 incredible stories that are true or a lie. Each player must decide whether he now wants to believe a story or not. Who typed correctly, gets a chip. Who first gets ten chips is the winner.
For 2-6 players aged 6 years.

116591.name: Vendetta
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
116591.description:
A group of terrorists have kidnapped a professor working on a bomb as well as his daughter. A few weeks later, they have started to make impossible demands and have threatened to detonate a miniature nuclear weapon if the demands are not met.

The protagonist, initially armed with only a knife, decides to rescue both individuals. Along the way, he collects other weapons and evidence to convince other police officers to let him continue his work, as he heads to an army base, a booby-trapped airplane, and finally central park where the terrorists make the last stand.

Source: Wikipedia, "Vendetta (1989 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116592.name: Uuno Turhapuro muuttaa maalle
116592.description:
Uuno Turhapuro muuttaa maalle is a side-scrolling video game, available for the Commodore 64. It was developed by the Finnish programmer Pasi Hytönen in 1986.

The game is based on the popular Finnish comedy character Uuno Turhapuro, created by Spede Pasanen and played by the actor Vesa-Matti Loiri. The game was released in the same year as the movie with the same name. Uuno Turhapuro muuttaa maalle was the first Finnish game based on a movie license.

Uuno Turhapuro muuttaa maalle is a traditional 2D side-scrolling game, where the screen continuously scrolls from left to right. The player is controlling the character Uuno vertically by avoiding different obstacles and a few odd enemies like birds and angry neighbors. The player must travel a certain distance with four lives and earn money in the process.

The game consists three different levels loosely based on a movie. In the first level Uuno has a farming plough and he's being pulled behind the car (you don't see the actual car in the game) on the dirt road of his hometown. In the second level he's water skiing and in the final level Uuno is at the local forest looking for his father's moonshining stills.

Source: Wikipedia, "Uuno Turhapuro muuttaa maalle (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116593.name: UNO Dice Game
116593.description:
BASIC DESCRIPTION:
The UNO Dice Game attempts to translate the original UNO card game into a two player dice game. It was released during the 2011 Christmas season and displayed along with other Mattel dice games in the same type of soda can tin packaging.

COMPONENTS:
The game includes 11 dice. Each die is unique and has some combination of faces in the four UNO colors (yellow, green, blue and red). The die faces include: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, draw one, draw two, and wild (in black). Note that there are no die faces that represent the Skip or Reverse cards from the original UNO card game (presumably because this is just a 2 player game).

GAMEPLAY:
The game mechanic is simple and mimics the original UNO card game. To begin, 5 dice are randomly given to each of the two players. These dice take the place of a players hand of cards in the original UNO card game. The 11th die is left in the middle of the play area to form the start of the dice line (think UNO discard stack from the original card game). The starting player rolls their dice and has to match either the color or value of the most recently placed die in the dice line.
